intro: Taraxacum subintegrum, commonly known as the woolly dandelion, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and a single, yellow flower head that develops into a white, fluffy seed ball. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this species thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant is known for its ability to spread via wind-dispersed seeds, contributing to its wide distribution. Its botanical features make it a common sight in meadows and along roadsides.
